result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas Phillips was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Repeater], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence. Eligible for CIP and SAP.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law if not previously provided.  Defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  AMENDED 10-18-2022:  Court ordered financial obligations amended to include attorney fees.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.

Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent.  Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation. No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). Comply with any child support orders.

10:46 AM Defendant Nicholas Phillips in court, in custody.  Attorney Wendy S. Paul in court for Nicholas Phillips.  Prosecuting attorney Brian Van Schyndel in court for the State of Wisconsin. Digital Court Reporter: Hannah Wronkowski.  Upon plea to Cts. 2, 3 and 4 the State would recommend 2 yr. WPS, 1 yr. IC and 1 yr. ES on each count, concurrent to each other and concurrent to revocation.  Court performs plea colloquy with the defendant.  Defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily enters his plea.
Plea:
Ct. 2- GUILTY
Ct. 3- GUILTY
Ct. 4- GUILTY

BTC: 
Ct. 2- GUILTY, 2 yr. WPS, 1 yr. IC and 1yr. ES.
Ct. 3- GUILTY, 2 yr. WPS, 1 yr. IC and 1yr. ES.
Ct. 4- GUILTY, 2 yr. WPS, 1 yr. IC and 1yr. ES.
Concurrent to each other.  Concurrent to revocation.  

Conditions:
No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). 
Comply with any child support orders.  
No alcohol or controlled substances to be monitored by random UA's/breathalyzers.  AODA Assessment and any follow through with any recommendations from agent.  
Obtain and maintain full time employment.
Court Costs.
DNA Sample and Surcharge.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Racine County Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. No contact with the victim N.C. (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances. This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance.

1:58 PM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Nicholas Phillips appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Sophia Dolan appeared by video for Nicholas Phillips. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Victim N.C. appears via zoom. Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Initial appearance on March 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
